restorative:
恢复健康或体力、精神 的 
having the ability to make a person feel strong or healthy again
petty:
小的；琐碎的；次要的 
small and unimportant

小气的；注重琐事的；狭隘的 
concerned with small and unimportant matters, especially when this is unkind to other people
hyper:
既兴奋又紧张的；精力过旺的 
excited and nervous; having too much nervous energy
infest:
大批滋生；骚扰；寄生于；大批出没 
(of insects or animals) to be present (in a place or site) in large numbers, typically so as to 
cause damage or disease
treacherous:
奸诈的；背信弃义的；不可信任的 
tending to betray; not able to be trusted
transmission:
传送，传播 
the act or process of sending electrical signals to a radio, television, computer, etc.
omen:
预兆 
something that is believed to be a sign or warning of something that will happen in the future
bolster:
支持，改善，增强 
to make (something) stronger or better; to give support to (something)
harass:
侵扰；骚扰 
to annoy or worry somebody by putting pressure on them or saying or doing unpleasant 
things to them

不断攻击敌人，袭扰 
to make repeated attacks on an enemy
bait:
鱼饵；诱饵 
food put on a hook to catch fish or in nets, traps, etc. to catch animals or birds

下诱饵； 在鱼钩上、陷阱中等放诱饵 
to place food on a hook, in a trap, etc. in order to attract or catch an animal
torrid:
炎热干燥的 
very hot and usually dry

激情的 
showing or expressing very strong feelings especially of sexual or romantic desire 
152
hierarchy:
等级制度 
a system in which people or things are placed in a series of levels with different importance 
or status
counterclaim:
反要求；反索赔；反诉 
a claim made in reply to another claim and different from it
absorbing:
吸引人的 
fully taking one's attention
hint:
点滴；微量 
a very small amount of something
furry:
毛皮覆盖的 
covered with fur

毛皮般柔软的 
having a soft surface like fur
exile:
流亡者 
a person who has been forced to live in a foreign country; a person who is in exile

放逐 
a situation in which you are forced to leave your country or home and go to live in a 
foreign country
cavity:
洞，腔 
a hole or space inside something
expedient:
权宜之计的，应急有效的 
providing an easy and quick way to solve a problem or do something
demarcate:
标出 的界线；给 划界 
to mark or establish the limits of something
tenacity:
韧性，不屈不挠 
the quality or state of being tenacious
centennial:
一百周年的 
the 100th anniversary of something (such as an important event)
lucrative:
有利可图的 
producing money or wealth; profitable
usurp:
篡夺 
to take and keep (something, such as power) in a forceful or violent way and especially 
without the right to do so 
153
divergence:
意见、态度等的分歧，差异 
a difference or conflict in opinions, interests, wishes, etc.
brainchild:
个人或小群体的主意，发明 
an idea or invention of one person or a small group of people
eradicate:
根除 
to remove (something) completely; to eliminate or destroy (something harmful)
devout:
衷心的 
loyal to something; devoted to a particular belief, organization, person, etc.

虔诚的 
deeply religious; devoted to a particular religion
counterproductive:
事与愿违的，产生相反效果的 
not helpful; making the thing you want to happen less likely to happen
vigorous:
有活力的 
done with great force and energy
pandemic:
全国流行的，全球流行的；普遍的 
(of a disease) prevalent over a whole country or the world

疾病的大流行，广泛传播 
an outbreak of a pandemic disease
infallible:
不会犯错的 
not liable to mislead, deceive, or disappoint
caravan:
旅行队 
a group of people or animals traveling together on a long journey especially through the desert
recur:
再现 
to happen or appear again; to occur again
tally:
记录；积分表；账 
a record of the number or amount of something, especially one that you can keep adding to

说法、数字等与 符合 或一致；吻合 
to be the same as or to match another person's account of something, another set of figures, 
etc.

计算总的数目、成本等；合计 
to calculate the total number, cost, etc. of something
exhort:
劝告，劝戒 
to try to influence (someone) by words or advice 
154
reclaim:
开垦 
to make (land) available for use by changing its condition

回收利用 
to get (a usable material) from materials that have been used before
carnival:
狂欢 
a festival held before lent that includes music and dancing
strive:
努力 
to try very hard to do or achieve something
irretrievable:
不可纠正的；无法挽回的 
not able to be retrieved or put right
calamity:
灾难 
an event that causes great harm and suffering
inquisitive:
好奇的，爱打听的 
tending to ask questions; having a desire to know or learn more
discrete:
分离的 
separate and different from each other
nominal:
名义上的，象征性的 
existing as something in name only; not actual or real
batch:
一批；一炉；一次所制之量 
an amount of something that is made at one time
carnal:
肉体的；肉欲的 
of or relating to the body; sexual or sensual
residual:
剩余的 
remaining after a process has been completed or something has been removed

剩余 
a residual product or substance
annihilate:
摧毁 
to destroy (something or someone) completely
genesis:
创始，起源 
the beginning of something
eccentric:
古怪的 
tending to act in strange or unusual ways 
155
authenticate:
证明真实 
to prove that something is real, true, or genuine; to prove that something is authentic
satiate:
满足 
to satisfy (a need, desire, etc.) fully
sanctity:
神圣 
the quality or state of being holy, very important, or valuable
ardent:
热情的 
having or showing very strong feelings
assault:
人身攻击；殴打； 身体侵犯 
the crime of trying or threatening to hurt someone physically

袭击 
to violently attack (someone or something)
earnest:
认真的，热心的 
serious and sincere; not lighthearted or playful
mentality:
智力，心智 
a particular way of thinking
equilibrium:
平静 
a state of emotional balance or calmness
induce:
引起，导致 
to bring about or give rise to

成功 劝诱 
to succeed in persuading or influencing (someone) to do something
boon: 福利 something pleasant or helpful; a benefit or advantage — usually singular
canopy:
顶罩，苍穹，华盖状的东西如树冠 
a covering (usually of cloth) that serves as a roof to shelter an area from the weather
peculiar:
独特的 
not usual or normal; strange
chide:
斥责 
to express mild disapproval of (someone); to scold (someone) gently 
156
foreshadow:
预示 
to give a suggestion of (something that has not yet happened)
scandalous:
不道德的；令人震惊的

gullible:
易受骗的 
easily fooled or cheated
forlorn:
孤苦伶仃的；孤独凄凉的 
of a person appearing lonely and unhappy 人

地方 凄凉的；荒芜的 
of a place not cared for and with no people in it

不大可能成功的；难以实现的 
unlikely to succeed, come true, etc.
obstinate:
固执的，执拗的，倔强的 
refusing to change your behavior or your ideas; stubborn
chromosome:
染色体 
one of the very small parts like threads in the nuclei (central parts) of animal and plant

cramp:
痛性痉挛；抽筋

腹部 绞痛

阻碍，阻止 发展或进步 
to prevent the development or progress of somebody/something
laborious:
辛劳的 
requiring a lot of time and effort
vacancy:
职位空缺 
a job or position that is available to be taken

空虚 
the state of being vacant
inexcusable:
不可原谅的 
too bad or wrong to be excused or ignored
humiliate:
羞辱；使丧失尊严 
to make somebody feel ashamed or stupid and lose the respect of other people
credence:
相信

glimpse:
瞥见 
to look at or see (something or someone) for a very short time

情况；局面 
the general appearance or character of something
glint:

眼睛 闪露出某种感情 
a small amount of emotion seen in a person's eyes
beyond_measure:
极度，非常
